DOC.brief_summary: Is goal directed fluid therapy reducing postoperative complications in comparison to traditional fluid therapy for gastro surgical ASA III/IV patients? The investigators compare two groups of patients: one group receives goal directed fluid therapy guided by LiDCOrapid stroke volume variation (SVV), the other gets the "traditional" fluids, ie the current regime.
DOC.brief_title: Traditional Versus Goal Directed Perioperative Fluid Therapy in High Risk Patients
DOC.criteria: Adult ASA class III & IV (high risk) patients >18 years scheduled for gastrointestinal surgery involving laparotomy Both elective and emergency cases Atrial fibrillation Mental impairment, unable to give informed consent Severe aortic or mitral stenosis Type of surgery: Liver surgery, transthoracic oesophagectomy
